required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The study retrospectively reviewed the medical records of patients who received adult liver transplantation in Changhua Christian hospital from 2002 to 2019. We collected their personal data about liver disease, laboratory data about liver function, pre-transplant evaluation and post-transplant outcome. We investigate what prognostic factors may contribute a good survival outcome, and improve our clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: number of participants with morbidity and mortality after surgery
primary_outcome.description: post-operative complications which requiring interventions, related to organ failure and hospital mortality

intervention.description: liver transplantation for chronic liver disease or acute liver failure

study_pop.textblock: Patients with acute liver failure or chronic liver disease due to different etiologies received liver transplantation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who received adult liver transplantation in Changhua Christian hospital from 2002 to 2019
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients who did not have suitable donor for liver transplantation

overall_official.affiliation: Department of General Surgery, Changhua Christian Hospital, Changhua, Taiwan

reference.citation: Lee SG, Hwang S, Moon DB, Ahn CS, Kim KH, Sung KB, Ko GY, Park KM, Ha TY, Song GW. Expanded indication criteria of living donor liver transplantation for hepatocellular carcinoma at one large-volume center. Liver Transpl. 2008 Jul;14(7):935-45. doi: 10.1002/lt.21445.

Chang Y, Cho Y, Lee JH, Lee YB, Cho EJ, Yu SJ, Sinn DH, Kim BH, Kim SH, Yi NJ, Lee KW, Kim JM, Park JW, Kim YJ, Yoon JH, Joh JW, Suh KS. Comparison of Models for Tumor Recurrence after Liver Transplantation for the Patients with Hepatocellular Carcinoma: A Multicenter Long-Term Follow-Up Study. Cancers (Basel). 2019 Sep 3;11(9). pii: E1295. doi: 10.3390/cancers11091295.

results_reference.citation: Mazzaferro V, Llovet JM, Miceli R, Bhoori S, Schiavo M, Mariani L, Camerini T, Roayaie S, Schwartz ME, Grazi GL, Adam R, Neuhaus P, Salizzoni M, Bruix J, Forner A, De Carlis L, Cillo U, Burroughs AK, Troisi R, Rossi M, Gerunda GE, Lerut J, Belghiti J, Boin I, Gugenheim J, Rochling F, Van Hoek B, Majno P; Metroticket Investigator Study Group. Predicting survival after liver transplantation in patients with hepatocellular carcinoma beyond the Milan criteria: a retrospective, exploratory analysis. Lancet Oncol. 2009 Jan;10(1):35-43. doi: 10.1016/S1470-2045(08)70284-5. Epub 2008 Dec 4.
